channel.title: Comments on: Writing Romantic Subplots: Part 2
channel.description: Stellar Short Fiction by Women-Identified Writers Since 2010

item.title: By: Martha
item.dc:creator: Martha
item.description:
Thanks for a great post! I'm writing a boook and i have some questions, i hope you can answer. To your questions at the end of the article: "Do the story really need it?" I'm in doubt, about what that actually means. I mean, yes, i could take the romance out of my story, and there would still be a plot, but... Remove Solangelo from Rick Riordan's books, and there's still a plot. I could remove the characters, and there would still be a plot. Do you see what i mean? Is it enough to say "but I want to write a romance subplot", as answer to the post's first question? I have made the characters (almost) and i would really like to see them come together, but i don't know what i should answer the question with.
Tak, gracias and danke, for the post and i hope i can get some light on this matter. I hope i have made my question understandable.
